rules.ruleString: (Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {LAW7212} and  Incompatible with course version in {0061, 0080, 0082, 0086, 0094, 0546, 1074, 1497, 2317, 2708} with course status in {ENROLLED, INACTIVE, INTERMIT})
Must be enrolled in course owned by {50000567}

description: The unit examines the foundation and structure of the institutions and processes of the Australian legal system, including legal practice as a distinctive element within the Australian legal process.  It introduces the sources of authoritative law - statutes, delegated legislation and judicial precedents.  A case series is used to demonstrate the evolution of the common law within the constraints of the doctrine and practice of precedent.  The unit provides foundational knowledge and skills in the interpretation of judicial precedents and legislation and their application in legal problem-solving.  Students develop fundamental skills in legal research and legal writing.
